title: Is going 0/10+ reportable? (in Diamond)
body: While the rest of the team is positive or even? I mean for diamond 0/10+ usually means he is either boosted or trolls.

replies.body: A score in itself is not reportable. Is the person ACTUALLY intentionally feeding? I say actually, because I see too many people thinking having a poor game is feeding. Doing poorly is not reportable. Harassing someone for doing poorly is reportable. Intentionally feeding or trolling is reportable.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=mJEENbZN,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-03-29T18:18:40.692+0000)
>
> A score in itself is not reportable. Is the person ACTUALLY intentionally feeding? I say actually, because I see too many people thinking having a poor game is feeding. Doing poorly is not reportable. Harassing someone for doing poorly is reportable. Intentionally feeding or trolling is reportable.

I recently had a game with a ryze support, but I could tell he was new, because he was really cooperative and happy... but he got smashed so hard it almost looked like trolling. I think he was new to ranked, and I believe the number of instances and the length of their ranked career should be taken into account. While I am talking about bronze/silver and not diamond, to every level of play it's supposed to be about the same skill level ratio. I've seen those funny bloopers with master tier players totally screwing up. We are human beings, with a  myriad of ailments and afflictions that could reduce our overall performance quality. I played a game as WW jungle, went 12/1/13. Then I played another game as WW and went even. Then I played a game as panth vs a Swain thinking I could burst him down.... and I learned a very important lesson in matchmaking that day.
The point is, I didn't get mad at Ryze feeding. I just sighed and resigned myself to playing it out.

Sometimes you just *really* have a bad game. Maybe your connection decided to start acting up after the game started, maybe you're just barely making the wrong decisions or are getting outplayed and it's snowballing, maybe your lane opponent is far better than the rest of your team's opponents, or you are getting 4v1'd constantly with no help. It happens to everyone across all ranks.

You have to decide for yourself whether they are performing poorly intentionally, the numbers alone don't mean that.

Playing bad / having a bad game is not ever punishable in any way shape or form. If you are bad in general, your MMR (and therefore your rank) will adjust accordingly.

You can go 0-20 in Master and still not be intentionally feeding / reportable.

that depends, if that guy was hard focused then no, if he was LEEEROY-ing their 5 man grouping alone undertower or inting then yes you can. a negative score is only then reportable if it was caused on purpose, which is the essential Definition of a feeder and a troll, someone who sabotages the game on purpose to benefit the enemy. So if These 0/10 scores were caused due to him wanting it to be then yes you can report him, otherwise we just have to assume he had a VERY bad day

You keep speaking about 'zero assists', but I don't think OP or anyone else has mentioned the score was 0-10-0. That's probably why you're being down voted. The OP is probably down voted because Riot has already stated several times that bad performance is not reportable.

OP is very specific, asking if you can report a 0/10+ score based on an assumption that they are either boosted or inting, and providing no clear evidence of wrong doing. The score alone is not reportable. And the boosting or inting is nothing more than an assumption based on what the OP wrote. There are valid reasons to have a horribly bad game (roommate started downloading bit torrent, serious lag or computer problems, etc.)
